body_html:
When you use cmake to config the project, did you enable GPU? __syncwarp should be defined in tensorflow/tensorflow/core/util/cuda_kernel_helper.h already.

For the windows related post, you can get some idea about how to resolve undefined symbols issues if you ever want to build a c++ program using the compiled tensorflow library. It won't help you much if you only need to use the python API.
body_text:
When you use cmake to config the project, did you enable GPU? __syncwarp should be defined in tensorflow/tensorflow/core/util/cuda_kernel_helper.h already.
For the windows related post, you can get some idea about how to resolve undefined symbols issues if you ever want to build a c++ program using the compiled tensorflow library. It won't help you much if you only need to use the python API.
body:
When you use cmake to config the project, did you enable GPU? `__syncwarp` should be defined in `tensorflow/tensorflow/core/util/cuda_kernel_helper.h` already.

For the windows related post, you can get some idea about how to resolve undefined symbols issues if you ever want to build a c++ program using the compiled tensorflow library. It won't help you much if you only need to use the python API.
